en.purpose:
Provides inclusion/exclusion criteria when deciding to use tPA on a patient with acute ischemic stroke.

INSTRUCTIONS

Institutions may have slightly different absolute and relative contraindications to Tissue Plasminogen Activator (tPA); this list is meant to be a quick reference, but practice should be guided by institutional protocol and consultation with neurology. Reflects recommendations from Demaerschalk et al, Stroke 2015.
en.use:
The principal risk of tPA is symptomatic or fatal hemorrhage. It is essential that patients be evaluated for any history or risk factors that would put them at an increased risk of a hemorrhagic outcome.

For patients within the 3-hour window who meet the inclusion criteria and have no contraindications, earlier administration of tPA was associated with improved outcomes in one randomized trial (NINDS II)
en.misuse: should not be used for patient that are less than 18 years of age

other_details.references:
1. 	Jauch EC, Saver JL, Adams HP, Bruno A, Connors JJ (Buddy), Demaerschalk BM, et al. Guidelines for the Early Management of Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke. Stroke [Internet]. 2013 Mar [cited 2022 Mar 25];44(3):870–947.

2. 	Adams HP, Brott TG, Furlan AJ, Gomez CR, Grotta J, Helgason CM, et al. Guidelines for Thrombolytic Therapy for Acute Stroke: A Supplement to the Guidelines for the Management of Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke. Circulation [Internet]. 1996 Sep [cited 2022 Mar 25];94(5):1167–74. Available from: https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/full/10.1161/01.cir.94.5.1167

3.     De Silva DA, Manzano JJ, Chang HM, Wong MC. Reconsidering recent myocardial infarction as a contraindication for IV stroke thrombolysis. Neurology. 2011 May 24;76(21):1838-40. doi: 10.1212/WNL.0b013e31821ccc72. Epub 2011 Apr 13

4.     Selim M, Kumar S, Fink J, Schlaug G, Caplan LR, Linfante I. Seizure at stroke onset: should it be an absolute contraindication to thrombolysis? Cerebrovasc Dis. 2002;14(1):54-7. doi: 10.1159/000063724.

when: ($gt0003|Age|<18,a)||(($gt0005|Clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing neurological deficit|==local::at0080|NO|)||($gt0006|Time of symptom onset <4.5 hours|==local::at0082|NO|))
then: $gt0033|tPA Recommendation|='Patient does NOT meet inclusion criteria for tPA'

when: $gt0005|Clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing neurological deficit|==local::at0079|YES|

($gt0008|Intracranial hemorrhage on CT|==local::at0014|YES|)||(($gt0009|Clinical presentation suggests subarachnoid hemorrhage|==local::at0016|YES|)||(($gt0010|Neurosurgery, head trauma, or stroke in past 3 months|==local::at0018|YES|)||(($gt0011|Uncontrolled hypertension (>185 mmHg SBP or >110 mmHg DBP)|==local::at0020|YES|)||(($gt0012|History of intracranial hemorrhage|==local::at0022|YES|)||(($gt0013|Known intracranial arteriovenous malformation, neoplasm, or aneurysm|==local::at0024|YES|)||(($gt0014|Active internal bleeding|==local::at0026|YES|)||(($gt0015|Suspected/confirmed endocarditis|==local::at0028|YES|)||(($gt0016|Known bleeding diathesis|==local::at0030|YES|)||($gt0017|Abnormal blood glucose (<50 mg/dL)|==local::at0034|YES|)))))))))
$gt0005|Clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing neurological deficit|==local::at0079|YES|
then: $gt0033|tPA Recommendation|='Patient has absolute contraindications to tPA and it should NOT be given'

when: ($gt0019|Only minor or rapidly improving stroke symptoms|==local::at0072|YES|)||(($gt0020|Major surgery or serious non-head trauma in the previous 14 days|==local::at0070|YES|)||(($gt0021|History of gastrointestinal or urinary tract hemorrhage within 21 days|==local::at0068|YES|)||(($gt0022|Seizure at stroke onset|==local::at0066|YES|)||(($gt0023|Recent arterial puncture at a noncompressible site|==local::at0064|YES|)||(($gt0024|Recent lumbar puncture|==local::at0062|YES|)||(($gt0025|Post myocardial infarction pericarditis|==local::at0060|YES|)||($gt0026|Pregnancy|==local::at0058|YES|)))))))
$gt0005|Clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing neurological deficit|==local::at0079|YES|
then: $gt0033|tPA Recommendation|='Patient eligible for tPA but has relative contraindications; consider and discuss risk/benefit with patient, family, and neurology consultation.'

when: ($gt0003|Age|>80,a)||(($gt0028|History of prior stroke and diabetes|==local::at0054|YES|)||(($gt0029|Any active anticoagulant use (even with INR <1.7)|==local::at0056|YES|)||(($gt0030|NIHSS >25|==local::at0052|YES|)||($gt0031|CT shows multilobar infarction (hypodensity >1/3 cerebral hemisphere)|==local::at0050|YES|))))
$gt0005|Clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing neurological deficit|==local::at0079|YES|
then: $gt0033|tPA Recommendation|='Patient eligible for tPA but has contraindications if onset >3 hours; consider and discuss risk/benefit with patient, family, and neurology consultation'

gt0003.description: Age in years, and for babies: months, weeks or days

gt0005.text: Clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke causing neurological deficit
gt0005.description: Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.

gt0006.description: Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.

gt0010.text: Neurosurgery, head trauma, or stroke in past 3 months

gt0011.text: Uncontrolled hypertension (>185 mmHg SBP or >110 mmHg DBP)

gt0013.text: Known intracranial arteriovenous malformation, neoplasm, or aneurysm

gt0019.text: Only minor or rapidly improving stroke symptoms

gt0020.text: Major surgery or serious non-head trauma in the previous 14 days

gt0021.text: History of gastrointestinal or urinary tract hemorrhage within 21 days

gt0023.text: Recent arterial puncture at a noncompressible site

gt0028.text: History of prior stroke and diabetes

gt0029.text: Any active anticoagulant use (even with INR <1.7)

gt0031.text: CT shows multilobar infarction (hypodensity >1/3 cerebral hemisphere)

gt0033.description: Additional narrative about the risk assessment not captured in other fields.

gt0038.text: Additional Warnings to tPA >3hr Onset Rule
